dict.string: In 1642, the same year that Galileo died, he was born in a small sheep-rearing village in the east of England.
His mother wanted him to become a farmer like his father, but he hated it and she was persuaded to send him to school.
Based on his studies of the Bible, he estimated that the world would end no sooner than 2060.
He was obsessed with alchemy and spent half his lifetime in a vain search for the philosopher's stone.
While serving as a member of Parliament, he spoke only once, and that was to request that a window be closed.
He never married or had any romantic relationships, resulting in a widespread belief that he died a virgin.
In 1816, one of his teeth was sold for an exorbitant amount and made into a ring, but no one knows where it is now.
He was good with his hands and built his own research tools, including the first practical telescope.
Born prematurely, he was a small baby, and his mother stated that he could have fit inside a quart mug.
He developed theories on calculus at home when his university closed as a precaution against the Great Plague.
He was secretive in his scientific and mathematical discoveries, which led to many quarrels over credit.
As a teenager, he considered himself as a sinner and wrote a list of 48 sins he committed, like punching his sister.
